channel.title: 317 PI Need Help Restricting Characters In Chat
channel.description:
Hi,
I found out that players on the server I'm working on can use tags like [code]<col=-225><shad=-225><img=1>[/code] While they are typing in game chat so they can pretend to be staff when they're not, so what it will show in chat is ' [player] playername: [Admin] hello all '. I think this is a big issue if your players arent the most inteligent and they think they're speaking to staff.
Could someone help me with expeling characters like < and > in chat?? I would really be happy if someone can help me with this.
Thanks.

item.description:
@Samih1996 wrote:

[quote=“deadlyhorror, post:2, topic:523657”]you could i guess add a filter to your command, something like this:

if (playerCommand.startsWith("yell")) { /* *This is the sensor for the yell command */ /*String text = playerCommand.substring(5); String[] bad = {"chalreq", "duelreq", "tradereq", ". com", "c0m", "com", "org", "net", "biz", ". net", ". org", ". biz", ". no-ip", "- ip", ".no-ip.biz", "no-ip.org", "servegame", ".com", ".net", ".org", "no-ip", "****", "is gay", "****", "crap", "rubbish", ". com", ". serve", ". no-ip", ". net", ". biz"}; for(int i = 0; i < bad.length; i++){ if(text.indexOf(bad[i]) >= 0){ return; } }*/[/quote]

This worked! Thanks for your help.
